qas.question: While many, the perceptions of Christianity can sometimes what?
Regardless of beliefs, Christians all agree that Jesus has a unique what?
Whether one partakes in practices or beliefs, the label Christian is sometimes attached because they associate with what?
What regarding a proverbial sense is sometimes conflicting?
All Christians disagree with what about Jesus?
Which group of people believe Jesus does not hold a unique significance?
What term is used to describe anything associated with conflict?

context: There are <b3_0>diverse interpretations<b3_0/> of Christianity which sometimes <a0_0>conflict<a0_0/>. However, "Whatever else they might disagree about, <b5_0>Christians<b5_0/> are at least united in believing that Jesus <b4_0>has a unique <a1_0>significance<b4_0/><a1_0/>." The term "<b6_0>Christian<b6_0/>" is also used adjectivally to describe anything associated with Christianity, or in a proverbial sense "all that is noble, and good, and Christ-like." It is also used as a label to identify people who associate with <a2_0>the cultural aspects of Christianity<a2_0/>, irrespective of personal religious beliefs or practices.
